fact_check_explanation_title: No published data to support minister’s claim about migrants saying they’re under 18
fact_check_explanation_summary: Robert Jenrick’s claim that up to 20% of adult men arriving at an asylum processing centre say they’re under 18 has prompted new questions about the Home Office’s use of …
A post on Instagram claims that Covid-19 is a ‘lie’. This is false, and there is ample evidence to prove it is a real, deadly disease.

fact_check_explanation_title: Wetherspoons still not offering free ‘meal for two’ Facebook deal
fact_check_explanation_summary: Another post from an account calling itself ‘JD Wetherspoon’ promising free meal offers has received thousands of shares on Facebook.

fact_check_explanation_title: BBC graph showing impact of Autumn Statement contains several errors
fact_check_explanation_summary: A graph shown on the BBC News at Six contained, among other things, an inaccurate figure and a mislabelled axis.

fact_check_explanation_title: Labour MP wrongly claims £37bn spent on Test and Trace app
fact_check_explanation_summary: Karl Turner claimed that Matt Hancock and Boris Johnson “blew” £37 billion on the Track and Trace app. The app’s actual cost in the first year was about £35 million.

fact_check_explanation_title: Iran hasn’t sentenced 15,000 protesters to death
fact_check_explanation_summary: Iranian parliamentarians have called for “harsh punishments” which could include the death penalty, but we can find no evidence for viral claims that 15,000 people have already been sentenced to …

fact_check_explanation_title: Warning over alleged Christmas postal ‘scam’ is long out of date
fact_check_explanation_summary: The premium-rate number a Facebook post warns about was shut down in 2005.

fact_check_explanation_title: British Heart Foundation comments on 30,000 excess deaths lack important context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Not all of the 30,000 excess deaths involving heart disease in England since the pandemic started were necessarily caused by healthcare disruption. Many may have been caused by Covid-19.

fact_check_explanation_title: MailOnline muddles up cost of a possible rise in council tax
fact_check_explanation_summary: If council tax rises by 5%, it would cost households in an average band D property about £100 more per year—not per month.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some staff at NHS hospitals did take part in local strikes when Labour was last in power
fact_check_explanation_summary: The shadow health secretary claimed there were no strikes in the NHS during Labour’s last spell in government, but we’ve found some examples of local strikes taking place.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake alerts for missing pensioners are circulating online
fact_check_explanation_summary: The names, pictures and locations of those being sought are false.

fact_check_explanation_title: Wetherspoons ‘meal for two’ deal is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: Thousands of people have shared a Facebook post which claims that Wetherspoons boss Tim Martin is retiring.
